title: Malaysia's biggest lender Maybank posts 11 pct drop in Q4 net profit
text: February 28, 2018 / 5:20 AM / Updated 35 minutes ago Malaysia's biggest lender Maybank posts 11 pct drop in Q4 net profit Reuters Staff 1 Min Read KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 28 (Reuters) - Malaysiaâ€™s largest bank by assets, Malayan Banking Bhd (Maybank), posted on Wednesday an 11 percent decline in fourth-quarter net profit, despite a slight rise in net interest income. Excluding one-off proceeds from the sale of securities in 2016 the profit rose by 22.4 percent, a statement released by the bank showed. Net attributable profit for October-December was 2.13 billion ringgit ($542.95 million), compared to 2.4 billion ringgit in the corresponding period a year earlier. The result compared with the 2.3 billion ringgit average of estimates from two analysts, according to Thomson Reuters. (Reporting by Liz Lee Editing by Muralikumar Anantharaman)
